context: Diesel approaches the player directly for the first time and challenges them to a touge duel

lines.text: You're checking your tires in the lot behind the ramen place on 7th when a shadow falls across your hood. You look up.

It's him. The man from that night — the one who watched you from the dark. Up close, he's older than you expected. Late forties, maybe. Deep lines around his eyes. Hands that have turned a million wrenches.
He doesn't smile. He doesn't introduce himself. He just stands there and lets the silence do the talking.

lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: I've been watching you.

lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: Harbor Road. The Proving Grounds. You drive like someone with something to lose.

choices.text: Yeah, I saw you that night. What do you want?
Watching me? That's not creepy at all.

lines.label: diesel_answers_who
lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: Doesn't matter.

lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: Names are for people who need to be remembered. I need to see something first.

lines.label: diesel_answers_direct
lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: Good. You pay attention. That matters more than speed.
He nods once — barely perceptible. Like you just passed some test you didn't know you were taking.

lines.label: diesel_answers_joke
lines.text: Nothing. Not even a flicker. The joke dies in the air between you like a spent match.

lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: Listen.

lines.label: diesel_challenge
lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: Route 9. The mountain pass above the harbor. You know it?

lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: Touge run. You and me. Downhill.

lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: No money. No crowd. No prize.

choices.text: If there's no prize, what's the point?

lines.label: diesel_explains
lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: The point.
He pauses. Looks up at the sky like he's pulling the words from somewhere deep.

lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: I don't care if you win. I want to see how you drive when nothing's on the line. That's when the truth comes out.

lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: Anybody can drive fast for money. I want to see your heart.

lines.label: diesel_time
lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: Tomorrow. 2 AM. Top of Route 9. Be there or don't. I won't ask twice.
He turns and walks back to his car — that same matte black coupe. No badge, no decals, no vanity. Just machine.
The engine starts with a sound that makes your stomach drop. Deep, mechanical, alive. Whatever is under that hood has no business being on a public road.
He pulls away without looking back. You stand in the lot, heart hammering, and realize you've already decided. You'll be there.
